revised_title: Navigating the East Indies: A Historical Analysis of Ancient Geographical Knowledge
tldr: The author examines the geographical knowledge of the ancients in the East Indies, focusing on the discrepancies between modern and ancient maps. They analyze Ptolemy's work and compare it to modern charts, discussing the inaccuracies and assumptions made by the ancients in their understanding of the region.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History
